greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations p of [n] such that in 0p the sum of all jumps equals 2n.
comment: An up-jump j occurs at position i in p if p_{i} > p_{i-1} and j is the index of p_i in the increasingly sorted list of those elements in {p_{i}, ..., p_{n}} that are larger than p_{i-1}. A down-jump j occurs at position i in p if p_{i} < p_{i-1} and j is the index of p_i in the decreasingly sorted list of those elements in {p_{i}, ..., p_{n}} that are smaller than p_{i-1}. First index in the lists is 1 here.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..300
maple: b:= proc(u, o) option remember; expand(`if`(u+o=0, 1,
a:= n-> coeff(b(0, n), x, n):
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 02 2017
